intro: Randia beccariana, commonly known as the beccarian randia, is a tropical shrub native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white to pink flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, smooth seeds. Randia beccariana is often found in wetlands and along riverbanks, where it thrives in moist, shaded environments.
